text: As arctic front nears, when will icy weather develop in South Texas? Here’s a timeline. - expressnews.com

text: NASA is about to send people to the moon — in a spacecraft not everyone thinks is safe to fly - CNN
fullText: As the four-person crew of Artemis II prepares to launch on a historic mission around the moon as soon as February, some experts are worried about the spacecraft’s heat shield.

text: Indiana's Fernando Mendoza, likely No. 1 pick, enters NFL draft - ESPN
fullText: Indiana quarterback Fernando Mendoza, who won the Heisman Trophy and led the No. 1 Hoosiers to their first national championship this past season, is forgoing his final college season and entering the NFL draft, he announced on social media Friday.

text: The Battle Between Tom Brady’s Heirs for a Spot in the Super Bowl - The Wall Street Journal
fullText: Jarrett Stidham was once drafted as a potential successor to the New England quarterback. Instead, he’ll be lining up against Drake Maye and the Patriots in Sunday’s AFC Championship.

text: Microsoft Gave FBI Keys To Unlock Encrypted Data, Exposing Major Privacy Flaw - Forbes
fullText: The tech giant said providing encryption keys was a standard response to a court order. But companies like Apple and Meta set up their systems so such a privacy violation isn’t possible.

text: 149 Million Usernames and Passwords Exposed by Unsecured Database - WIRED
fullText: This “dream wish list for criminals” includes millions of Gmail, Facebook, banking logins, and more. The researcher who discovered it suspects they were collected using infostealing malware.

text: 5 arrested in connection with shooting of Indiana judge and his wife - NBC News
fullText: Police have arrested five people as part of a multi-state investigation into the shooting of an Indiana judge and his wife while they were at home on Sunday

text: The Trump administration admits even more ways DOGE accessed sensitive personal data - NPR
fullText: New court documents reveal even more ways DOGE improperly accessed and shared sensitive personal data last year — and how that data appears to have been used to advance dubious fraud claims.

text: Trump looks left on cost of living concerns - Politico

text: Scientists just overturned a 100-year-old rule of chemistry, and the results are “impossible” - ScienceDaily
